Detailed Description

Wrapper class around the C++ base logging system. Provides log services by channel and severity.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Destructs the logger object.

This will delete all registered objects.

Member Function Documentation

◆ GetSeverityLowerBound() [1/2]

LogSeverity IonicSecurity::SDK::LogBase::GetSeverityLowerBound ( )

Determines the lowest severity level (if any) that the logger will accept.

This is a convenience function for IonicSecurity::SDK::LogBase::GetSeverityLowerBound(String^ msChannelName) that provides nullptr for the channel name (msChannelName).

Returns
Returns the lowest severity level that the logger will accept for the given channel (if provided). If msChannelName is set to nullptr, then all channels are considered.

If the logger will accept any severity level, then this function will return the lowest defined severity level, which is SEV_TRACE.

If the provided channel is not registered with the loggger, meaning that the logger does not write any logs to the channel, then the lowest severity level cannot be determined and SEV_INVALID is returned.

◆ GetSeverityLowerBound() [2/2]

LogSeverity IonicSecurity::SDK::LogBase::GetSeverityLowerBound ( String^  msChannelName)

Determines the lowest severity level (if any) that the logger will accept.

Parameters
[in]msChannelNameThe optional channel name to use for determining the lowest severity level for. If this is set to nullptr, then all channels are considered.
Returns
Returns the lowest severity level that the logger will accept for the given channel (if provided). If msChannelName is set to nullptr, then all channels are considered.

If the logger will accept any severity level, then this function will return the lowest defined severity level, which is SEV_TRACE.

If the provided channel is not registered with the loggger, meaning that the logger does not write any logs to the channel, then the lowest severity level cannot be determined and SEV_INVALID is returned.

◆ Log()

void IonicSecurity::SDK::LogBase::Log ( LogSeverity  eSeverity,
String^  msChannelName,
int  nLine,
String^  msFile,
String^  msData 
)

INTERNAL USE ONLY See Welcome to the Ionic Security .NET SDK! for the public logging interface!!

//Excluding from doxygen until this function is useful

Parameters
[in]eSeverityOne of the severity types (e.g. SEV_TRACE, SEV_INFO).
[in]msChannelNameThe channel name to write through. This channel should be registered into one or more sinks.
[in]nLineThe line number of the calling code, typically provided via StackFrame::GetFileLineNumber().
[in]msFileThe file name or file path of the calling code, typically provided via StackFrame::GetFileName().
[in]msDataThe log message string.

Writes a log using the message string provided by msData.

◆ Logf()

void IonicSecurity::SDK::LogBase::Logf ( LogSeverity  eSeverity,
String^  msChannelName,
int  nLine,
String^  msFile,
String^  msFmt,
...array< Object^> ^  args 
)

INTERNAL USE ONLY See Welcome to the Ionic Security .NET SDK! for the public logging interface!!

//Excluding from doxygen until this function is useful

Parameters
[in]eSeverityOne of the severity types (e.g. SEV_TRACE, SEV_INFO).
[in]msChannelNameThe channel name to write through. This channel should be registered into one or more sinks (see LogSink).
[in]nLineThe line number of the calling code.
[in]msFileThe file name or file path of the calling code, typically provided via StackFrame::GetFileName().
[in]msFmtThe Console::WriteLine()-style format string (e.g. "Print this string {0} and this integer {1}").
[in]...argsVariable number of inputs to be used in conjunction with msFmt (same usage as printf).

Writes a log using Console::WriteLine-style formatting.
